p: Differences in viral genotypes, such as the occurrence of specific changes in the viral genome, can also result in the heterogeneous ability for a given FP A. aegypti population to transmit the virus [9], [10], [19]. For example, ZIKV isolates collected from the explosive outbreaks that occurred from 2013 in FP and elsewhere were shown to have an alanine-to-valine amino acid substitution in the non-structural protein 1 compared with previous isolates of the same lineage [19]. This mutation was found to facilitate viral acquisition by A. aegypti mosquitoes and subsequently to enhance viral prevalence in mosquitoes [19]. This may have facilitated the spread of ZIKV during the outbreak in FP.
